lexUnit.name: feel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be aware of (something happening) through physical sensation

sentence.text: After an hour or two of observing the various shapes and sizes of mouths crammed with teacake the novelty began to wear off and I felt a bilious attack coming on .
She felt the blood draining from her .
I bathed my face with water and felt hot fingers beginning to tickle my back .
He could feel his heart thudding furiously and hoped desperately that he 'd succeeded in making his voice sound casual .
Ludens felt himself blushing .
To her consternation she saw him push the door to a close and felt the pulse drumming in her throat as the lethal blue stare narrowed .
She could feel the relief welling inside her .
Suddenly I felt something hot on my hands .
She winced in pain as she felt a shock across her back at the impact .
Then he felt a cool draught across his chest and arms as the outer door opened and someone entered the bedroom .
He had almost reached it when he felt a searing pain across the back of his neck , and realised that he had been slashed with something sharp .
Bend from the waist , first to the left until you feel the stretch along upper arms , and hold for 10 counts , then to the right .
She lay in a huge , curtained bed and felt the ice around her heart begin to melt , her mind begin to function again .
Isabel felt the barriers around her heart shake .
She felt his arms around her waist , and turned to face him .
Begin to feel the energies around you .
Feel all the space around you .
Ted Parsons had got ashore , but when lying rock-still he felt a gun behind his ear and was captured .
Yes , thought Dyson , at that I can feel a pricking behind the lids of my eyes !
Still able to feel the firm sand beneath her feet , she swam quietly for a few minutes , before turning over on to her back .
Alice ran without looking back , scarcely feeling the pavement beneath her feet .
She could barely feel the pedals beneath her feet .
She jumped back in surprise as she felt his fingers beneath hers , twined around the handle .
He could feel the old wood beneath his fingers , smell the strong pine scent of the fire .
Feel the soft grass beneath your feet .
Kathleen felt a prickle between her shoulderblades and knew the camera was approaching .
He went across and started to feel the fur between the stag 's ears .
He sat beside her , close enough for her to feel the heat from his body .
Having rested he now felt the chill from his soaked and muddy clothes .
Tolonen said Novell is not feeling any competitive pressure from Microsoft Corp 's Windows for Workgroups .
Five year old Dick can see the colour changes and feel vibrations from the bubble tube .
Feel vibration from your own voice through the vibrator ; do n't think about it or analyse how it happens -- just let it happen .
Can I feel tension in either of my legs ?
Could he feel the vibration in her shoulders from her heart , hammering like a piston behind her breastbone ?
His voice was marked by flat northern vowels and was so soft Dexter felt the muscles in his cheeks tense as he strained to hear .
He felt the key in his pocket .
Her body started to tremble , totally beyond her control , as she felt the astringent liquid soak into her skin .
Tallis felt wind on her face as a stone whirred past .
He was silent a moment , feeling the summer on his bones .
He had barely registered this fact when he felt a tap on his shoulder .
She felt the skin on it stretched to bursting point , the pain was awful .
Charity felt a tickle on the back of her neck as lightning split the air .
If you feel excess pressure on your front arm , move the line towards the mast and vice versa if the back arm seems overworked .
Clutching a handkerchief to his own face , he felt blood over his eye but he assured them it was superficial , and gave instructions which were followed to the letter .
Lisa felt a chill go through her .
I 'd feel the prickly cases through my gloves ,
I was fully clothed , how come I could feel the warmth through my sweater ?
Some people who have become severely deafened do not wear rubber soles on their shoes because they can only feel the vibration through the floor when wearing leather soles .
I felt it through the seat of my pants , and grinned .
She put a hand on his arm and felt the rhythmic shivering through the stuff of his jacket .
You feel a soft click through your fingers before you have pressed a key as far as it will go .
He felt wet grass under his cuffed hands , knew he was on the verge of a road somewhere .
Then , suddenly , I felt the ground under my feet .
They could feel the added chill from where they were standing .
Shaking was felt from Ayrshire to Cornwall and Kent to Dublin , but damage was limited mainly to roof slates and chimney stacks .
I can feel again beneath my fingers the vigorous resentment of the caterpillar , the wet , leathery hydrangea leaves , and my mother 's little work-worn hand .
He found his belly seething and bubbling with movements he could feel quite clearly beneath his hands .
As she grappled with the staples she could feel inside the bag the firm shape of a book .
He felt a trickle of blood down his arm from the scratch on his shoulder , and pulled the torn sleeve more tightly round it , hoping Ruth would n't notice the damage and make a fuss .
He explains how he felt a tingling sensation down his left-hand side but did not immediately call for help .
